title: Quarkus Dev Service: TLS Support for Keycloak
body:
### Description

## Feature Request

### Background & Rationale
In the context of local development setups, the current usage of Quarkus Dev Services presents a challenge due to the inability to run Keycloak over HTTPS with a simple TLS certificate. The core of this issue relates to the Microsoft Authentication Library's (MSAL) stringent requirement for HTTPS connections, which is non-negotiable even in local development scenarios, as per the ongoing discussion in their issue tracker ([MSAL Issue #6631](https://github.com/AzureAD/microsoft-authentication-library-for-js/issues/6631)).

### Problem
The existing issue with MSAL (which may not be resolved due to their security policies) demands that we adapt our local development environment to comply with HTTPS requirements. This requires a way to easily implement TLS for services like Keycloak when using **Quarkus Dev Services**.

### Proposed Change
It is imperative to provide an enhancement to **Quarkus Dev Services** that enables the use of a TLS certificate, preferably self-signed for simplicity, for the Keycloak instance. This will bridge the gap between local development practices and the HTTPS enforcement by security libraries such as MSAL.

### Use Cases
- **Local Development:** Ensuring that local services can be accessed over HTTPS to align with libraries like MSAL that strictly enforce secure connections.

### Acceptance Criteria
- The ability to configure a TLS certificate for Keycloak within **Quarkus Dev Services** is provided.
- The configuration process must be simple and streamlined to support rapid and hassle-free local development setups.

Given the potential complexities in simplifying this process for local development, I am open to feedback and any collaborative approaches to resolve this issue.
